ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. I learned a lot from the course.
I would recommend it to someone wanting to learn about medical applications of physiology.
I would recommend this to other students, particularly if they have clinical backgrounds. This class was well taught and a good way to review the molecular basis of many diseases
Yes. It's a class with moderate workload and you really learn things from it.
I would recommend this course primarily for Dr. Sigworth's lectures. The other lectures were interesting, but I felt like I got the most from Dr. Sigworth's foundational lectures.
I'd definitely recommend it to undergraduate students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It taught me many new things.
It is outside of my field, but it did a good job of developing an appreciation for physiology.

While this course does not have any direct contribution to my research, it was a good refresher of the pathogenesis of many diseases that I had not encountered since my medical school days. I really enjoyed that aspect of the course. I also thought that the workload was entirely appropriate.
Dr. Sigworth's lectures on ion channel physiology will certainly help with my research, as I anticipate doing a lot of electrophysiology.
